channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: A man has been charged by police and is due to face court in September after he allegedly mowed down a pedestrian in a road rage attack in Perth's north on Thursday night.
item.title: Man charged after allegedly mowing down pedestrian in Dianella

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic continues to challenge Australia as Victoria moves towards the end of the fourth week of stage four lockdown.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 113 new COVID-19 cases as hotel quarantine inquiry resumes; Australian death toll jumps to 584

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: The final day of the Republican National Convention as the US is convulsed by violence and President Donald Trump declares his first term in office as a success.
item.title: US election 2020 LIVE updates: Donald Trump accepts Republican nomination at the RNC and lashes Joe Biden, Democrats

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Punters should be cautious about launching into Bob Peters’ stars Regal Power and Arcadia Queen in Saturday’s group 1 Memsie Stakes, according to their trainer.
item.title: Arcadia Queen, Regal Power aren't set to peak yet: trainer Williams

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: In an unprecedented move, the US President delivered his acceptance speech to the Republican party from the White House - a decision critics said was a flagrant abuse of presidential authority.
item.title: Donald Trump says Joe Biden will be the 'destroyer of American greatness'

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Andrew Robert Grant, 59, who taught at the prestigious Melbourne school for 12 years, admitted to obtaining and distributing the material outside Australia.
item.title: Former Scotch College teacher pleads guilty to child abuse material

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australia's oldest family-owned meat processor has been hit with a trade suspension by China, days after the Morrison government rejected a Chinese bid for Lion Dairy.
item.title: Australian beef hit with another China trade strike

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Knox
item.description: One skill above all has become essential to the modern-day coach: being sacked, and how to deal with it. Who will be next on the never-ending merry-go-round?
item.title: BS ball: who are the front-runners for NRL's sack race

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Blackburne has sold 80 per cent of its offering, including two penthouses totaling $32 million, the most expensive apartment sales in the state's history.
item.title: Construction at Subiaco's first luxury high-rise kicks off as east coasters look to buy west

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: A mother-of-two who defrauded nearly $100,000 from the federal government in the form of Centrelink benefits over a five year period had been spared any immediate time in prison.
item.title: Mother who defrauded almost $100,000 from Centrelink avoids jail

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Supreme Court Justice Jean Dalton found the mining giant had engaged in exploitative and dishonest behaviour with four users of its Abbot Point coal terminal.
item.title: Court orders Adani pay port customers $100m after charge dispute

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: The WA Football Commission said City of Fremantle's impressive bid and the inability of Optus to also host the colts and reserves grand finals swayed the decision.
item.title: Historic Fremantle Oval to host 2020 WAFL Grand Final

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian said it was really important people got tested the day they first notice the mildest of symptoms to avoid unintentionally infecting other people by continuing to operate in the community as normal.
item.title: NSW records 13 COVID-19 cases, City Tattersalls gym cluster grows

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: As New Zealand prepares to ease level three restrictions in Auckland, the country has reported 12 new coronavirus cases.
item.title: Majority of new cases in Auckland in returnees on Air India flight

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Residents in almost 90 suburbs across Victoria have been urged to boil water due to electrical damage caused by wild storms across Victoria on Thursday night.
item.title: Water supply contaminated after night of wild weather

item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has exposed the vulnerability of densely populated cities and provides an opportunity for future generations.
item.title: The pandemic is forcing us to rethink the future of cities

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Seven West Media has put Cricket Australia on notice that it may consider terminating its portion of the game's $1.2 billion television deal in a dramatic escalation of tension.
item.title: 'We have put them on notice': Seven could terminate cricket deal over quality concerns

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says the views of victims’ families were paramount in any decision about the murderer who was sentenced to life in prison without parole.
item.title: Australia open to taking mass-killer back from New Zealand

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: The heads of the hotels that hosted quarantined travellers raised concerns about the conduct of some of the security guards.
item.title: Security guards napped in corridors and smoked in stairwells, inquiry told

item.description: The post-pandemic world order shouldn’t be designed by an elite crowd on a Swiss mountaintop that most often gets it wrong.
item.title: The world can live without Davos when it recovers from COVID

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: US presidential election 2020

item.description: How did environmental issues become so politicised? The people purge early in the Abbott government – beginning in 2013 with the "night of the short knives" – gives some clues.
item.title: 'You bastards sacked me.' When the climate sceptics arrived

item.description: A new campaign is to be launched next week, sources say, arguing Britons who work from home could lose their jobs if bosses "never see" them.
item.title: British government to launch ad blitz to get people back to the office

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Three people, including four-year-old Ayan Kapoor, have been killed by falling trees after a cold front brought damaging gusts across Victoria on Thursday night.
item.title: Four-year-old boy among three killed in horror night of falling trees

item.dc:creator: Konrad Marshall
item.description: In this episode of Good Weekend Talks, ABC presenter and author Virginia Trioli and Sydney Morning Herald and Age columnist Jacqueline Maley discuss sex and power with Good Weekend editor Katrina Strickland.
item.title: The dispiriting deja-vu of our unending #MeToo

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Australian referee Amy Perrett will take the whistle in Friday's Brumbies and Western Force clash.
item.title: Perrett set to become first female Super Rugby referee

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: The state has recorded 113 new cases in the past 24 hours - the same number as yesterday - and the equal lowest since July 5, when 74 cases were reported.
item.title: New cases could drop below 100 over weekend - Sutton

item.description: Trump to formally accept nomination, attack Biden on final day of convention.
item.title: Tablet interactive: US presidential election 2020

item.description: Acronyms: give yourself a lab-coat with adjustable pocket protector if you can pick a RUN from a SWIM.
item.title: Alien alphabet on the radio

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The woman’s father said it would have taken too long to “jump through the hoops” to enter Queensland, and so his daughter had to be sent to Sydney instead.
item.title: Queensland is compassionate, Premier insists, after unborn baby's death

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Eric Moussambani became one of the Sydney Olympics' most famous athletes by battling to swim 100m. But, within a few years, the swimmer from Equatorial Guinea had made dramatic progress.
item.title: 'I used to be a very shy guy': What Sydney Olympics cult hero Eric the Eel did next

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: On September 1, 1990, the fabled Danihers became the only quartet of brothers ever to have appeared together in an VFL/AFL match.
item.title: 'Daniher to Daniher to Daniher to Daniher': 30 years on from a unique moment

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Jimmy Anderson this week became the first fast bowler to take 600 Test wickets. How did Australia view him?
item.title: Grumpy but great, Jimmy Anderson's road to greatness

item.dc:creator: Orietta Guerrera
item.description: Ross Gittins' column comparing the way the fortunes of the aged have improved relative to those of young adults sparked a debate between generations.
item.title: 'Poking the bear': young and old debate the divide in wealth and wellbeing

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: Over lunch, SBS host Mike Tomalaris talks about a Tour de France that will be very different this year.
item.title: Tour de France: 'It's chess on wheels, a love story, a tragedy, it's beautiful'

item.description: Almost half of NSW's locally acquired cases waited three days or more before taking tests; Victoria records 113 new cases; Australian death toll jumps to 584. News updates here.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 28, 2020

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: What started as a disagreement over in-game purchases could end up having serious ramifications for Apple.
item.title: Apple's legal battle over Fortnite could change the iPhone forever

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: NRL player Jack de Belin's rape trial is set to begin on November 2 following lengthy delays due to sensitive legal arguments.
item.title: Jack de Belin trial to proceed after delays

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The deal makes the Australian bookmaker NBC Sports's official betting partner in the US.
item.title: 'Transformational': NBCUniversal takes stake in Australian bookmaker PointsBet

item.description: What's most unbelievable about the Amazon Halo is that Amazon thinks consumers in 2020 might want one.
item.title: Amazon's creepy new health wearable analyses your voice and body

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Sales at electronics and furniture seller Harvey Norman have soared nearly 40 per cent through July and August despite lockdowns in Victoria and New Zealand.
item.title: Harvey Norman posts record result as COVID cocooning boosts demand

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: The loss was driven by a $1.32 billion writedown for its troubled business in America, but the building products maker was also hit by lower sales and production volumes in the pandemic.
item.title: Boral swings to $1.14b loss on US woes, scraps its dividend

item.description: Rolls-Royce has warned that its future could be at risk if the COVID-19 downturn becomes even more severe, with the collapse in air travel crushing their earnings.
item.title: Rolls-Royce says future 'at risk' after unveiling $9.8b loss
